bug.author: chrisgauthier9
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Unable to conda install Spleeter <denchmark-h:h2>Step to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Installed using conda Run as conda install -c conda-forge spleeter Waited 30 minutes for code to run Got error :
UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be incompatible with the existing python installation in your environment: Specifications:
anaconda-navigator -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|3.4.'] anaconda-project -> python[version='3.4.*|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] anaconda==2020.02 -> python[version='3.6.10|3.7.6|3.8.1',build='h359304d_2|h359304d_1|h359304d_0'] astropy -> python=3.4 autopep8 -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] backports.functools_lru_cache -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|3.4.|>=2.7,<2.8.0a0'] bkcharts -> python=3.4 bleach -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] conda-env -> python[version='2.7.|3.4.|3.5.*'] diff-match-patch -> python[version='2.7.|3.4.|3.5.|3.6.'] gevent -> python=3.4 h5py -> python[version='<3'] html5lib -> python[version='3.4.*|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] intervaltree -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.*'] jinja2 -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] joblib -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] jupyterlab -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] jupyterlab_server -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|>=2.7,<2.8.0a0|>=3.5,<3.6.0a0|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0|3.4.'] matplotlib -> python[version='3.6.*|<3'] mkl-service -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|3.4.'] mkl_fft -> python=3.4 mkl_random -> python=3.4 more-itertools -> python=3.4 navigator-updater -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0|3.4.'] networkx -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] numba -> python=3.4 openpyxl -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] packaging -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] partd -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] path -> python[version='>=2.7,<2.8.0a0'] path.py -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] pathtools -> python[version='2.7.|3.4.|3.5.|3.6.'] prometheus_client -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] pydocstyle -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] pygments -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] pytest-arraydiff -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|3.4.'] pytest-doctestplus -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0|3.4.'] pytest-openfiles -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0|3.4.'] pytest-remotedata -> python[version='2.7.|3.5.|3.6.|3.4.'] python-dateutil -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] qtawesome -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] seaborn -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] sortedcollections -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] sphinx -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] sphinxcontrib-websupport -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] testpath -> python[version='3.4.*|>=3.8,<3.9.0a0'] watchdog -> python[version='>=3.5,<3.6.0a0'] xlwings -> python=3.4 zict -> python[version='>=3.8,<3.9.0a0']
<denchmark-h:h2>Output</denchmark-h>
If python is on the left-most side of the chain, that's the version you've asked for. When python appears to the right, that indicates that the thing on the left is somehow not available for the python version you are constrained to. Note that conda will not change your python version to a different minor version unless you explicitly specify that. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS MacOS
Installation type Conda
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Just updated to catalina

comments.comment: What version of Python do you have installed
